data.title: Reassert some changes lost in rebasing in MiniYaml.cs.
data.body:
Some changes from the following PRs were lost in a rebase in #6984.

[Improve YAML parse time. #7232](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7232/files#diff-0)
[StyleCop cleaned OpenRA.Game Part 1 #7251](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7251/files#diff-20)

data.title: Nuget-provided windows dependencies don't work for many players
data.body:
playtest-20150118 would not run for many people, and we had to work around this by manually packaging a new installer with the dlls from release-20141029.  I expect this to be a regression from #7346, which I suspect will be caused by the nuget-provided dlls linking against one or more VC runtimes that some people don't have installed.

If this is indeed the problem, then it is a bit crap to expect players to install N different C runtimes before they can run OpenRA, so we should revert back to our previous working libraries.

data.title: Avoid a globally shared SheetBuilder in SpriteFont.
data.body: A globally shared sheet builder leaks memory and resources between mod switches. Instead, we create and inject the sheet builder during mod startup to ensure we still share the builder across all fonts, but can reclaim it when the mod is unloaded.

data.title: Try to fix RA2
data.body: Worst PR ever.

data.title: Ported allies03b to lua
Drop Ressources when Ressourcelimit is reached
data.body:
In earlier Games like RA/TS/RA2 when a Player has reached the limit of storageable Ressources the Ressources are wasted.

In OpenRA Harvesters cannot unload ressources when the ressource limit is reached and blocks
another Harvester to unload collected Ressources.

In this Case we should go the way:
- define an PerModOption to Say "WaitWhenFull" -> 0 / 1
- or go the legacy way of the older games for all mods
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/7871924-drop-ressources-when-ressourcelimit-is-reached?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Refactored the Pathfinder trait and algorithm to fit better the SOLID principles
data.body:
The pathfinder algorithm was hard to understand and the PathFinder class violated heavily the Single Responsibility principle and the Open-Closed principle. So I refactored it using the Decorator pattern design so classes can focus on a single operation (caching, calculations, logging (on the way)) while being easily and isolately expandable instead of having one bloated and hard-to-reuse-and-extent class.

I also modified the cachedpaths variable to use a Dictionary instead of a list, as order is not important in this case and insertions, deletions and lookups on a dictionary have cost O(1).

The Expand operation in PathSearch also was hard to understand, follow and unit test, so I've reorganized the responsibilities and extracted methods in an intent to make things easier to understand.

data.title: Fix compilation on mono 2.10.
Ignore buildlimits with AllTech cheat
data.body: Fixes #7352.

data.title: Removed the broken CI wiki update automation
data.body: Setting this up in a reliable and secure manner takes a lot longer than deploying this manually. Especially now since we are down to very few releases per year.

data.title: Move parachutes and crates to Mods.Common
Added a warning before loading incompatible replays
data.body: This was demanded at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4528#issuecomment-33844159 by @pchote and is also useful to reduce the number of support requests https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/FAQ#old-replays-crash-the-game.

data.title: "Build everything" dev cheat should override the build limit for actors
data.body:
As I understand, it currently doesn't, which seems weird to me. Also might prevent you from properly/easily testing an actor that has a build limit. (Or just prevent you from having some fun with 
10 \* Mammoth Mk 2 in the enemy base :D )

data.title: Added appveyor PushArtifact to fix deployment
data.body: Deployment failed for https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7345, because it could not find the artifact. https://ci.appveyor.com/project/OpenRA/openra/build/1.0.669 This should help according to http://www.appveyor.com/docs/packaging-artifacts and http://www.appveyor.com/docs/environment-variables.

data.title: Set buildlimit on special units as like in vanilla TS
data.body:
This are not all (some are not implemented)
This PR limits the Buildlimit (as like in TS) to 1
- Mammouth MK II
- EMP Cannon
- OXanna
- Umagan
- Tratos
- Ghosttalker
- Cyborg Commando
- Cameleon Spy
- Hijacker
- Slavic

these buildings are also limited (but not implemented)
- Nod Waste facility
- Nod Temple (?!)
- Core defender
- a few others

data.title: EMP Cannon should act as SupportPower (EMPSpecial)
data.body:
We introduced the EMP logic for TS to get this work but we should transform them to an EMPSpecial as like in vanilla TS.

In the Moment the EMP is a game killer because:
- When i build of a Wall of EMP Cannons the Game will lag
- The EMP Cannon is firering every second
- Buildlimit should be limited to 1

data.title: Players Credits can produce an integer overflow
data.body:
When we enter 6x `/givecash 999999999` then we will produce an overflow of the integer value.
In the moment the Game will crash because we have no "-" sprite for the Cash values which can display negative values.

data.title: Fixed the IDE build again
data.body: I accidentally broke it during the many rebases of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7307.

data.title: Added most native Windows dependencies to the fetch script
data.body:
Further work upon https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6863 to make it possible to package this on Linux again. Otherwise it will unnecessarily fail with:

```
Fetching SDL2 from nuget
./fetch-thirdparty-deps.sh: line 51: nuget: command not found
```

even though all CLI dependencies are resolvable.

data.title: Moved Windows setup deployment to AppVeyor
data.body: as we're using Travis' Docker infrastructure #7311 to avoid the nuget timeouts, but in those containers, we can't install packages properly, so the build of the packages fails.

data.title: OpenRA should have a maximum value for Player credits
data.body: When we use `/givecash` too often (maybe adding 6x 999999999 Credits), then the game will crash or will produce problems. My Idea is to set an global maximum value (`uint.maxval` ?!)

data.title: Fixed Travis deployment by adding NSIS stubs and plugins
data.body: http://packages.ubuntu.com/trusty/nsis-common

data.title: Do not try to draw "null" sprites
data.body:
This Pr prevents a crash which can happen when we pass "null-sprites" to DrawSprite

To Reproduce this Crash:
- Add more than 999999999++ Credits to player
- game will crash with NRE 

Dependencies:
#7344

data.title: Fix travis build not exiting in the top-level directory
AI-units don't realign turret after attacking and moving back to base
data.body:
#6503 is broken again

I noticed, that some AI-units not realign its turret when they attacked and moving back to base

A Titan was moving backward to the AIs Base and aimed my tank.... after i destroyed the aimed tank the titan has realign its turret :/
- My idea is to check the Range when the range is larger than X Cells then the AI should drop the target

data.title: Fix showing wrong IP for server admins in the lobby client tooltips
data.body:
The external IP will now only be resolved for the local client.

Fixes #7303.

I couldn't test this since UPnP doesn't work for me (that's why I never could reproduce the problem, btw).
